intro: Stylogyne gentryi, commonly known as the Gentry's stylogyne, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
